org.nodes.util

Class Functions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nodes.util.Functions

  • public class Functions
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains several static functions (mainly mathematical) That are used throughout the library.
    Author:
    Peter Bloem

      • choose

        public static int choose(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Double> probabilities,
         double sum)
        Draws an integer according to specified probabilities. Draws a random integer i such that i's probability of being drawn is equal to the i'th double returned by the collection's iterator.
        Parameters:
        probabilities - A collection of doubles, summing to 1.0, whose n'th element defines the probability of n being drawn (first element is 0)
        sum - The sum of the values in probabilities. This valeu is not calculated from the collection for reasons of efficiency.

      • choose

        public static int choose(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Double> probabilities,
         double sum,
         java.util.Random rand)

      • randomMultinomial

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> randomMultinomial(int n)
        Produces a uniform random multinomial, ie. a list of n double values summing to one, so that each such list has equal probability. Algorithm from http://stats.stackexchange.com/questions/14059/generate-uniformly-distributed-weights-that-sum-to-unity
        Parameters:
        n -
        Returns:

      • probRound

        public static double probRound(double in)
        Probabilistically rounds the input. The result of this method is at least floor(in), and is ceil(in) with probability (in - floor(in))
        Parameters:
        in -

      • sample

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> sample(int k,
                                       int size)
        Samples k distinct values from the first 'size' natural numbers
        Parameters:
        k - The number of natural numbers to return
        size - The maximum integer possible + 1
        Returns:
        A uniform random choice from all sets of size k of distinct integers below the 'size' parameter. The result is not sorted.

      • isSquare

        public static boolean isSquare(long n)
        Test if n is a perfect square (ie. its square root is an integer). Code from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/295579/fastest-way-to-determine-if-an-integers-square-root-is-an-integer
        Parameters:
        n -
        Returns:
